opening_angle: Connect LuminDigital's focus on secure, reliable software delivery with my strength in building production-grade ASPM systems that reduce manual effort and improve remediation velocity
paragraph_focus: Core engineering identity: security-focused builder-operator who ships reliable automation for messy operational problems
Current UC role delivering ASPM systems, CI/CD integrations, and runbook-driven remediation at scale
Earlier automation work and phishing detection project demonstrating pragmatic engineering with measurable outcomes
Explicit alignment with Lumin's values: curiosity (threat briefings), trust (auditability), respect (cross-functional enablement), boldness (owned end-to-end delivery)
voice_controls: Use active verbs: built, integrated, delivered, automated, established
Replace adjectives like 'robust' or 'scalable' with concrete traits: containerized, documented, repeatable, maintainable
Avoid phrases like 'leveraged' or 'spearheaded'; use 'I built', 'I integrated', 'I created'
claims_to_avoid: No invented metrics (e.g., 'reduced MTTR by 70%') without source support
No hypothetical tooling—only reference tools explicitly named in evidence (e.g., Rapid7 InsightVM, Veracode, Qualys)
No theoretical security concepts without operational context
